Description: Glazed steatite oval plaque inscribed on one side with the name of Mau Sehetepibra, the Trusted Treasurer and Overseer of the North Land, and decorated with volutes, longitudinally pierced, the other side inscribed with hieroglyphs and decorated with three double volutes.
Bibliographic references: Martin 1971 / Egyptian administrative and private-name seals, principally of the Middle Kingdom and Second Intermediate Period (cat no.1637, pl.46.12)
